results.description:
In the not-too-distant past, there were two restaurants set side by side on Route 18 in Abington: a seasonal ice cream place called Cream, and a casual sit-down restaurant called Patty Joe's Po Boy Cafe, offering Southern specialties seldom seen in this area.

Cream is still there, but Patty Joe's has been reopened as Cream etc, a breakfast and lunch spot that's been garnering rave reviews for its menu of inventive and tasty dishes featuring locally sourced ingredients.


The things I've been reading about this little spot have had it on my radar for a few weeks, and now that my schedule has opened up a bit, it's time to head to Abington and find out if Cream etc can live up to its billing. I will say that some of the items on the breakfast menu sound like they bring some welcome variety to a meal that often looks much the same from one restaurant to the next.

Please join me there this Saturday, January 16th at 12:00, as we explore the culinary possibilities of breakfast, lunch and... etc...

Special Note: Like most breakfast and lunch restaurants, Cream etc is on the small side. Since we'll be going there on a Saturday afternoon, we may encounter a wait for a table. Please remember that lunchtime on Saturday is not the time to be in a hurry!


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Cream etc
Saturday, January 16th, 2016 @ 12:00 PM
 1209 Bedford St (Route 18)
Abington, MA 02351
(781)[masked]
Website: Cream etc</a>


Organizer: Mike

Guests: Yes, up to 2 per member.

Price Range: The menu items online range from $6.95 - $10.95. Have a look at the <a href="http://www.creametc.com/menu/">menu pages.


Event Fee: Annual Membership is $5.00 per year. The single-event fee for non-annual members and guests is $2.00.


Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for all of our meals in cash has been SSDOMG'S policy for over nine years. It allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone.

RSVP Deadline: Saturday January 16th at @ 10:00 PM. Any changes made after this time may not be seen by the Event Organizer. Please see our no-show policy below.


No-Show Policy: We have updated and greatly simplified our no-show policy. People who RSVP "Yes" to events are expected to exercise common sense and common courtesy. That means making your best effort to keep any commitments that you make, but if necessary doing your best to notify the Event Organizer or (preferably, if it's the day of the event) the venue if something comes up after the RSVP deadline. If you find yourself unable to attend an event that you've RSVPed "Yes" to and you cannot either change your RSVP or let the venue know, please do contact the Event Organizer when you're able to, just to let us know that you're okay and that you're still interested in attending events.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions: Cream etc is attached to Cream, a seasonal ice cream shop. The two restaurants are located on Bedford St (Route 18) in Abington. Parking is in an adjacent lot.

Muchas gracias por vuestra participación en la charla de la semana pasada y a Gaby por haber recomendado y presentado el libro a pesar de tener la garganta hecha polvo…...  Y muchísimas gracias por vuestra generosidad en donar libros para niños (y a Mary Liz por coordinar esta iniciativa conmigo).  ¡Hemos donado más de 56 libros para regalar a niños de habla hispana en Boston!  ¡Chapó, amigos!  Entre los donantes hemos figurado nosotros y Schoenhof´s que también ha donado 5 libros.  Gracias también a todas las aportaciones a la fiesta de traje (y disculpas a los que habéis pensado que se trataba de una fiesta de gala….;-).  Y una cordial bienvenida a nuevas integrantes Ana, Mónica y Verónica.

El sábado 16 de enero nos reuniremos en Schoenhof´s para comentar "El héroe discreto" de Mario Vargas Llosa, ganador del premio Cervantes.  La sinopsis es  siguiente: www.casadellibro.com/libro-el-heroe-discreto/[masked]/[masked] Al final el libro NO estará disponible en Schoenhof´s.  Mil disculpas por parte de Schoenhof´s, que había pedido los ejemplares a una editorial que luego le informó la semana pasada que ya no ofrecía dicho libro.  El libro está disponible en muchas grandes librerías y vendedores en línea como Barnes & Noble y Amazon. 

Debido a problemas de suministro, estoy aún trabajando con los de la librería para ver cuál de las selecciones de lectura va a estar disponible para vender en enero y leer en febrero.  Espero tenerlo aclarado esta semana.  En cuanto lo sepa, os informaré sobre la lectura de febrero y todas las lecturas de 2016. 

Muchas gracias por vuestra participación a lo largo del año 2015.  ¡Felices fiestas y mis mejores deseos a todos para un próspero año 2016!

Un fuerte abrazo,

Mark

There will be no face to face meetup unless we reach 50 RSVPs by Thursday of the week. You must be enrolled in one of the 10 FREE courses below or similar courses. 

Our past experience is that 20% of the RSVP shows up in the weekend meetings. Considering that, unless we have about 50 RSVPs, we cannot have a face to face meeting. Please use the questions / answers / discussions below for now. While asking questions, please make reference to the name of the course and the related module within the course. 

Cousera offers the following classes towards obtaining highly valuable knowledge/skills in Data Science Specialization. It is sometimes hard to work on the exercises and homework without the help of an expert.  Receiving one-on-one help from an expert can improve the commitment of finishing the program with accelerated learning. With that in mind, we are experimenting with the following service.


An expert (MS or PhD in Statistics) will answer any question free that takes less than 10 minutes to solve. There are nominal fees for one-on-one interactive help.  Please use the following link to request for help, or just email [masked] or call[masked]-8864.

http://www.tutorteddy.com/courses/coursera-course-help.php

The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

R Programming

Getting and Cleaning Data

Exploratory Data Analysis

Reproducible Research

Statistical Inference

Regression Models

Practical Machine Learning

Developing Data Products

Data Science Capstone

results.description:
Onyxbirds Travel Meetup has had many milestones since its beginnings eight years ago. They include over 1,000 meetups and nearly 1,000 members. One of the most noteworthy accomplishments being charter member and organizer, Kimberley traveling to her seventh continent this year.

The number of trips members continue to suggest and organize have been plentiful, varied and amazing experiences with many friendships happening along the way.

It's great to see pictures posted by Obirds of our local and international adventures. These photos have moved, inspired and amused. 

Join us to share your travel stories and/or to hear from your fellow Obirds. You're also encouraged to share ideas for new Onyxbird trips.

Meet us in the Teri room on the mezzanine at the Grove Hall Library.

Bring family and friends....the more the merrier!

Bring your laptops, iPads, smartphones and travel guides.


Expect refreshments, trip information and prizes for everyone who stops by.

There is FREE parking next to the Grove Hall Library 41 Geneva Avenue Dorchester 02121 (617)[masked]

results.description:
We're going to do a 10-week training program, and it's going to be fun! All levels are welcome. We'll start by timing ourselves the first week in a few key events (e.g. 100 freestyle), then we'll do a training program to get ourselves faster. At the end of 10 weeks we'll time ourselves again and see how much we've improved! If you can't make a week, don't worry, you can still come to the other weeks.


The 10 weeks will include clinics on technique, flip turns, and any special requests, as well as some good sets to get us swimming faster. If there's a race you're targeting and want to work on that distance or event, let us know and we can help tailor the workouts for you.

---------------


The pool opens at 2pm, so we meet to go in at 1:45 so that we can be out on the pool deck by 2. $6 to get in, Cambridge residents $5 (or you can buy a 10-pack for an approximate 10% discount, and we do these weekly so you'll have the opportunity to use them up).

Street parking is available but stressful, and the 69 bus drops off down the block, or you can bike or run there and do 2/3 of a triathlon :)

results.description:
Boston has so many wonderful things to offer, so let's be a "Tourist in Our Own City" and visit the newly renovated JFK Presidential Library and Museum!

http://www.jfklibrary.org/Exhibits.aspx

"Through our permanent exhibits, visitors to the museum learn about the career of John F. Kennedy, the challenges he faced, the decisions he made, and his commitment to public life as he speaks for himself on film, video, and sound recordings from the Library's audio-visual collections.  Exhibits on the Kennedy presidency focus on such hallmarks as the Cuban Missile Crisis, the Peace Corps and the Space Program.  Exhibits on Attorney General Robert Kennedy and the president’s Oval Office deal primarily with the growing Civil Rights movement of the early 1960’s. A series of displays highlight first lady Jacqueline Kennedy’s role in the historic restoration of the White House, which culminated with her celebrated televised tour of the President’s House in 1962."

Please note admission prices are as follows:

- Adults $14
- Seniors 62+ $12
- College Students with ID $12
- Youth/Teens 13-17 $10  
- US Armed Forces Veterans* $10
- Members of the JFK Presidential Library and Museum FREE
- Members of any Presidential Library operated by the National Archives FREE
- Members of the John F. Kennedy Library New Frontier Network FREE
- Children 12 and under FREE
- US Armed Forces Active Duty Personnel with ID FREE

John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum
Columbia Point, Boston, MA 02125
(617)[masked]

results.description:
About Seth Godin:

SETH GODIN is the author of 18 books that have been bestsellers around the world and have been translated into more than 35 languages. He writes about the post-industrial revolution, the way ideas spread, marketing, quitting, leadership and most of all, changing everything. You might be familiar with his books Linchpin, Tribes, The Dip and Purple Cow.

In addition to his writing and speaking, Seth founded both Yoyodyne and Squidoo. His blog (which you can find by typing "seth" into Google) is one of the most popular in the world.

He was recently inducted into the Direct Marketing Hall of Fame, one of three chosen for this honor in 2013.

Recently, Godin once again set the book publishing industry on its ear by launching a series of four books via Kickstarter. The campaign reached its goal after three hours and ended up becoming the most successful book project ever done this way.

His newest book, What To Do When It's Your Turn, is already a bestseller.

To Secure Your Spot Register Here

About the Event: 

By: Seth Godin & Do You Zoom, Inc.

This is a new way to learn, designed for people who seek to make a difference.

A live online course that students do together, guided by pre-recorded video... using real-time writing and interaction to create change and connection.

A three-hour intensive workshop, with all participants in sync. Start together, finish together, interact.

Like the altMBA, we run this workshop in a private, customized Slack room. But this workshop lasts just three hours, and it's a sprint.

Some learning doesn’t easily come from a mere lecture. It comes from engagement. Engagement with others, fellow students, people on the same path as you. And even more important, from self awareness, from writing and speaking about what matters, what you see and what you are capable of.

This intensive workshop is designed to explore what it means to be a leader, and more important, what it means for you to be a leader.

It's designed for anyone who has ever sought to make a difference. For entrepreneurs, middle managers, parents and everyone who has ever needed to stand up and say, "follow me."

There is just over thirty minutes of original video, but far more important are the 120 minutes you will spend on doing the work, writing and connecting. Connecting not only with the video, but with the other students in the course.

Most online courses are done solo, on your own time. This three-hour workshop is different.

Here's how it works: 

As the workshop unfolds, there are nine sections on various facets of leadership.

First, each section starts off with a video which I've recorded specifically for this course, dropped into the Slack room.

Next, there is an exercise or discussion prompt for you to work on with your group in Slack. You'll answer the question and work on your own writing.

Finally, you'll come together with other participants in Slack to engage on what you've learned via live chat.

The sections:

- Leadership is not management

- See the end before you begin the journey

- Culture defeats everything

- Selling the dream

- Enrollment

- Don’t forget rule 6

- Authority vs. responsibility

- Certain failure

- It’s personal

After the session is over, you will have a written record of the transformation you’ve caused in yourself and in others.

100% of our revenue is going to Acumen to help them create more courses for social entrepreneurs and those hoping to make an impact.

We're looking forward to engaging with you.

PLEASE NOTE! You will get a further instructions on the confirmation page after purchasing a ticket. You'll also get an invite to the Slack room, from Slack, the morning of the event. Please check your spam folder... you'll need the link to access the course.

WHEN

Saturday, January 16, 2016 from 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM (EST) 

WHERE

Online, in a private Slack room

To Secure Your Spot Register Here

results.description:
Practice and learn within the warm waters of the Salem, MA YMCA pool!  

Each session runs from 3-5pm on Saturday with 30 minutes on each side for moving boats, changing, etc. 

Register early as we allow only 8 boats in the pool! Preference is given to those seeking instruction. There are 3 options: 

1. For those with their own equipment and just want to practice for 2 hours in the pool, the fee is $20. 

2. For those seeking professional instruction, but have their own equipment, the fee is $50.

3. For those seeking professional instruction, but need to use our equipment, the fee is $75.

Note: All equipment must be clean and free of debris. 

Registration will be complete when we verify via email. Please note that given the cost of renting the pool, etc, refunds are not possible unless inclement weather forces a YMCA closure. Thank you for your understanding.

To register, please go to http://mkt.com/salem...er-pool-session

results.description:
YOUR EXCLUSIVE 2016 RED SOX NATIVES GAME VIEWING EVENT will be hosted by the Red Sox Natives!

Please join us at Tony C's Sports Bar and Grille at Assembly Square in Somerville for the AFC Divisional Playoff Game on Saturday, January 16 at 3:15pm. The Patriots will play the AFC Wild Card game winner Kansas City Chiefs.

 If you RSVP YES you must arrive by 3:15pm to be seated and part of our Table Reservation. which will be limited to 12 fans.  The group can not be seated until everyone arrives. Please do not hold up the group. Native Assistant General Manager Mike will be there early. It is your responsibility to arrive early, communicate with and find him. We are looking for another Native to help host the event. Please contact Mike or Frank  or post a comment.

 Game Time is 4:35pm.

Some people will be staying for the second playoff game later.

Wear your Patriots gear.

Several volunteer Natives will arrive early and meet you at our reserved section. We will E Mail all yes RSVPs with more details the day of the game.  Expect a crowd. We STRONGLY advise you to arrive early rather than late to avoid any lines as Tony C's will be packed. Tony C's has 11,000 Square feet of space, has a capacity of nearly 500 (including patio), has over 90 HD Big Screen TVs and a JUMBOTRON along with the highest quality audio system!

Please make sure to maintain your own bar and food tab or pay as you order and tip your servers. If you are seated at a group table you may be part of a group bill. Please communicate with your servers in advance. Servers may take credit cards. 

Tony C's Sports Bar and Grill is a sports themed restaurant named to honor Red Sox legend and Massachusetts Native Tony Conigliaro. It combines a fresh, house-made menu of American comfort food and the highest quality HD audiovisual system available. Classic and specialty cocktails, an extensive beer list and American wines are featured on the menu.

Tony C's is located off Route 93 overlooking the Mystic River in the new Assembly Square. There is public parking in the area. The new MBTA Assembly Orange Line Subway station is 3 blocks away. 

Updates on Tony C's can be found on facebook.

 http://www.tonycssportsbar.com

The Red Sox Natives have been organizing Sports Game Viewing Parties over the last several years with guests from other invited groups attending. We have had a blast with up to 80 people attending at various locations in Boston, Somerville, Wakefield and Woburn.

See you there.

Go Pats!

GOOO PATS! WE KNOW YOU CAN DO IT! Best coaching, best quarterback best receivers, best game plans. THEY ALWAYS WIN and will this time despite a hurting team. (Injuries): they will find a way. Team has depth that is what coach Belichick has been brilliant at. Plus they had 2 weeks prep time.
OH! Spoiled are so Boston fans cause the Pats seem to win all the time!!

New England Pats at a sprawling sports bar with tons of TV screens (T line @ Porter Square) UNIQUE which PLAYS LIVE DJ MUSIC INSTEAD OF LOUD OBNOXIOUS ADS.

NOTE! This is Tavern in the Square PORTER not Central Sq!

Adversary Kansas City. They have won eleven games in a row. We had a blast here last year and parking is easy.

Don't just sit at a table .....YOU MUST ASK The HOSTESS to be seated at a TABLE of SIX PEOPLE. So when you arrive, announce yourself to the group, and as you form a small group of six....you can then ask for your table as soon as the group MAKES 6 people. DO NOT WALK IN & EXPECT TO BE SEATED RIGHT AWAY. The CLOSER to GAME TIME ....the LONGER the WAIT. Otherwsise, STANDING ROOM ONLY.

If you want a table protocol is 1) find the Meetup, 2) make a team of four or more, 3) go reserve a table at reception, 4) wait until your team is called when one becomes available, 5) have all of your team together when it is called. Last time wait wasn't long.
But getting there EARLY helps, I'll make sure this is scheduled at least 30 minutes before the game time. Which is 4:35.

The Wikipedia Day 15th Birthday Bash is a celebration to be held on Saturday January 16, 2016, hosted by the New England Wikimedians and supported by the Harvard University Language and Literacy Department and fellow Free Culture Alliance New England partners.

Participation (and pizza and cake!) will be free, with room for ~30 participants. All are welcome, and we are especially interested in seeing newcomers to join the experienced Wikipedians/Wikimedians. 
We will simply be having a party and celebration with cake and pizza. We will all introduce ourselves and talk about Wikipedia and the year ahead.


Date: Saturday, January 16, 2016

Time: 04:00PM to 08:00PM

Location: Boylston Hall, Room 403, 4th Floor, Department of Romance Languages and Literatures, Harvard University, Cambridge.

Map: http://map.harvard.edu/?bld=04330&level=9

Subway: Red Line - Harvard Stop. (2 Min walking distance from T stop)

Wiki RSVP: https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_15/Events/Boston#Sign_up

Facebook RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/486749654831344/

Meetup RSVP: http://www.meetup.com/wikipedia-5/events/227634518/

Twitter: @Wikipedia_15

Hashtag: #Wikipedia15

There is wifi access, and we will give you the log in details on-site.


https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_15/Events/Boston


Hope to see you soon.

First Come-First Served after 5PM and as long as there is food.

Haley House Cafe's Community Table Dinner welcomes neighbors for a delicious locally grown prixe fixe meal. All of the food will be prepared by Haley House Bakery Café staff.

Community Tables is more than just a meal. It is a time to meet neighbors, find common ground, and celebrate food and one another. The belief is everyone deserves a seat at the table and everyone has a story to tell.

Every Saturday evening Haley House Bakery Café serves a “Community Tables” dinner, inviting its customers to “pay-what-you-wish” for a full meal and dessert. The suggested cost for this meal is $10, and folks are asked to contribute what they can if they are able.

At the end of the meal, all attendees are presented with an envelope, in which they leave if they can an anonymous contribution for their meal.

Public Transit:

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit.

Orange Line subway to Ruggles Station then any bus to Dudley Station

Driving Directions:

Check out Google to arrange your driving directions

Parking:

FREE parking in lot on Dade Street as well as along Washington Street.

For more information, contact Jeremy at Haley House Bakery Café: (617)[masked]

- Top 2 Will Battle It Out In The Finals 120 seconds for 2 rounds,
and a Champion will be decided.

results.description:
If you wish to join us, get tickets for Section B - we'll all gather there and eat together. It will be a smaller group. Please order your tickets now at www.johnnyds.com . Tickets will sell out quickly and I can't guarantee you can join us unless you buy the tickets. Two bands, one full evening of dancing and musical fun.

The Band That Time Forgot:

This rag-tag group of hard working elders have meant a lot to many people through the years - from students to scientists, from bikers to full-swing golfers. And still they rise…. and fall ... and rise ... and stumble....and rise again Disgruntled with a lack of recognition and with babies on the horizon, Stash devised a name “The Band That Time Forgot ” and a concept - the band would play the greatest 60’s songs that nobody else would ever play. But a name with no band is no band. Stash called his pal Head West whose career he had been trying to ruin since 1972. There was only one truly great keyboard/guitar playing/singer to call Sonny California. After a few false starts they managed to convince Rainbow (then Richard) that such a band might have fun, make money, start a commune, have dozens of children, and eat many mushrooms. Rainbow being one the nicest guys in the world (everybody says so - though he can be very bad, too) said OK. And thus the band was born....

The Love Dogs: Take one red-hot horn section - we're talkin' alto, tenor, baritone saxes and trombone - down and dirty. Add liberal amounts of barrelhouse boogie-woogie piano and stinging Fender guitar. Pour over a funky and swinging rhythm section that Blues Review magazine called "the best in the business", and top it all off with a crazy and charismatic front man with one of the biggest blues voices around. Season with a few years on the road tearing up juke joints, festivals and concert halls across the U.S. and Canada and on both sides of the Atlantic. Sound tasty? It's a recipe for music and mayhem, for intensity and irreverence; it's THE LOVE DOGS.

Based out of Boston, this hard blowing septet just celebrated its sixteenth year wowing audiences and critics alike with their combination of great musicianship and pure fun. The Dogs combine elements of jump blues, New Orleans R&B and early rock 'n' roll into their own powerhouse sound. You can hear it loud and clear on their three Tone-Cool cds "I'm Yo Dog" (1996), "Heavy Petting" (1998) and "New Tricks" (2000). Many of the cuts from these three discs have been blues radio favorites, several of the Dogs' signature original songs have been used in feature films and on television, and one has even been sampled for use on the upcoming Run-DMC cd!

But as much fun as the Dogs' studio discs are, it's nothing compared to seeing them live. FMQB magazine called Love Dogs' concerts "the stuff of legend" where "soulful vocals, killer grooves, unpredictability and pure entertainment play equal parts". With their newest cd "Live And On Fire" The Love Dogs have finally captured the unbridled energy of their live show on disc. Far from a live retread of previously recorded tunes, "Live And On Fire" features ten brand new tracks captured live on a summer weekend at the famous Sea Note nightclub on the outskirts of Boston.

"It's important to us to have fun, and sometimes even we don't know what we're gonna do next." says lead vocalist and songwriter EDDIE "DUATO" SCHEER, a former sideman of R&B legend Johnny Adams. "We have a lot of humor in our music, and we love to surprise each other and make each other laugh. When a crowd can see that, it becomes contagious. Pretty soon they're giving us back as much energy as we're putting out, and the whole thing keeps escalating. We call it the 'tribal love vibe'".

Featuring some of the Northeast's best players, it's impossible not to notice the high level of musicianship in this band. "We're all lifetime fans of blues, jazz, and R&B, and we all have a real reverence for the music. Part of what makes this band special is that we really play together as a unit, and the whole is greater than the sum of its parts." The band's lineup consists of SCHEER, ALIZON LISSANCE (keyboards, vocals), MYANNA (alto/tenor sax, vocals), GLENN SHAMBROOM (guitar, baritone sax), RANDY BRAMWELL (bass, vocals), STEVE BROWN (drums, vocals), along with part time Dogs MARIO PERRETT (tenor sax/vocals), MARK PAQUIN (tenor sax, trombone) and old friend "SAX" GORDON BEADLE (tenor and baritone sax).

Part Rat Pack party, part 20th century musical encyclopedia, and part revival meeting, "Live And On Fire" showcases the Dogs at their best, leaving their audience breathless and begging for more. The New York Post says "Even though the music could make Leonardo's David dance, it's the songwriting that separates these dogs from the rest of the pack" and Blues Review agrees "If there were a Superbowl for crowd pleasing rhythm & blues, a photo of The Love Dogs would be on every Wheaties box in America." Scheer sums it up by saying "If this band doesn't put a smile on your face, check your pulse because you just might be dead."

go to Johnny D's and make reservations now - tickets are very limited, as are spaces at our tables. Get reservations for Section B - you must buy at least $15 worth of food. If you don't want to come for dinner, get general admission tickets, but please, get them in advance. This event will sell out. Tickets are $20 ea. Guaranteed Seating: For guaranteed seating, purchase a ticket in one of the main room zone B, arrive within designated time which is in your confirmation email, and purchase dinner that evening. $15 FOOD minimum per person plus 7% meal tax.

Drop me a note when you've bought your tickets, and I'll make sure you're seated with the group. Tickets at:

http://johnnyds.tunestub.com/event.cfm?id=226791&cart

It is tricky to find a wine that will go with most pasta sauces, but let's give it a try!   Barbera and Alfredo?  Sangiovese and Bolognese?  Montepulciano d’Abbruzzo and Marinara?

Bring a batch of your best pasta sauce (and the recipe!), a serving spoon, a wine glass or two, and a wine to pair.  I'll provide plenty of plain pasta and rice, and we'll have a walkabout tasting.  This is a great way to begin to learn about how to pair wines with food. You are not limited to Italian sauces -- just as long as yours goes well with pasta or rice.

results.description:
We will journey inward in a time-honored shamanic method of inner consultation. It is a way of communicating with your inner or spirit self and retrieving information. Your inner self is in constant communication with all aspects of your environment, seen and unseen. You need only journey within to find answers to your questions. Be prepared, however, for whatever insights you may receive, whether you like them or not.
The spirit healing journey is not always what people expect, and sometimes there is uncertainty as to what one should experience in altered states. The ecstatic trance is an individual journey into non-ordinary reality; therefore, experiences vary from person to person and from journey to journey. Once you enter a trance state, the rhythm or sound of the drum tends to change. The drumbeat may appear to speed up or slow down, while the sound may grow louder, softer, or disappear. You may experience a change in body temperature, feel energy flowing through your body, or find yourself twitching, swaying, or rocking. It is not uncommon to hear sounds or voices. You may even smell specific aromas. You may see colorful patterns, symbolic images, or dreamlike visions. Some people may find that they have a highly developed inner vision while others may rely more on instinct, intuition, or intent.
During the spirit healing journey, one's awareness transcends ordinary reality. In journeys to the Lower World, one may experience the sensation of falling, sliding, or spiraling downward into or under the Earth. In Upper World journeys, one may experience the sensation of rising, floating, flying, or spiraling upward through the air or sky. Journeys to the Lower World involve the movement of awareness to a level beneath ordinary reality and Celestial journeys involve movement to a level above ordinary reality. Lower levels are denser, lower in frequency, and more involved with the physical body, the earthly plane, and material reality. Higher levels are higher in frequency, less dense, and subtler.
You will experience at least two spiritual journeys. You do not need prior journeying experiences but an openness of the process and possibilities. Elaine is a training and practicing Shaman and will safely lead you on your journey. Please bring a yoga mat, blanket, something to cover your eyes (scarf), and journal as you may wish to write your experiences immediately following the journey. $10 Any questions or to register please contact Elaine [masked] or[masked]

Join us this new year for our 2016 Season of Reason Party! This will be our 8th winter celebration for the Greater Lowell skeptic and atheist community! 


Please come and enjoy some warm intellectual conversations around a variety of delicious potluck food-ery, fun science swap-ery, and maybe a little tomfoolery.

The science swap has been really fun in past years and it is now tradition. Be creative and have fun. It's not necessary to go shopping, but the item should be cool and interesting and not a discarded disinterest. Bring some kind of wrapped up science, reason, or skeptic themed gift worth around $15. Unique items make for a more competitive game. One swap-gift per person. We will swap at 8:30pm on the tick. The past years' parties have been fun and we're looking forward to bringing our friends back together for another great time.

For those attending: 
Please list food, drinks, and/or snacks that you plan to bring in the comments of this event page. This will help us to have a good variety of munchies. Darrick and I will start the food list...

~ Love Lindsay & Darrick ~


*** Note: Watch the comments below for additional info. ***

To effectively use the law of attraction, you need to know how to be in a high vibration; and having multiple options to help you do so can be very helpful.  More than anything, we believe that the key is to connect to your whole Spirit-Self, to Source Energy itself.


We'd like to share this with you, to activate you in this new higher vibration, and to introduce to you how to begin to feel and use it for yourself, as well. 


We are vibrational beings living in a vibrational Universe.  Join us in learning how to FEEL this energy, play with it, and benefit from it.  It's pretty cool!

results.description:
A great night of music right in downtown Mansfield. Rose Garden Coffehouse is now celebrating their 20th year of bringing live music to their cozy and intimate concert room in the basement of The Congregational Church.

The Featured Artist this time is Aztec Two Step

If you were awake in the ‘70s, the landmark duo Aztec Two-Step probably graced your turntable. Decades later, Rex Fowler & Neal Shulman are still vital voices in folk music. Sweetly affecting harmonies are melded with humor, poetic, driving songs and easy-going guitar riffs. Join us for this sure-to-be memorable night!


Advance Tickets Here:

http://www.rosegardenfolk.com/general/seatingnotice-04-Jan.php


PLEASE NOTE: By special arrangement we will have seats reserved for our group for the concert, so if you RSVP, please be courteous and show up!(And buy your ticket at the link above)

ROSE GARDEN FACTS: • We’ve been presenting shows continuously since 1989 • Fully staffed by volunteers • Smoke and alcohol free; wheelchair accessible • Home-baked desserts and hot/cold drinks of the season • Advance ticket sales only available through our website; tickets at door if shows not sold out in advance • In the event of a sellout, we reserve the right to sell your advance sale tickets after 7:50 pm if you have not arrived.
results.name: Aztec Two Step @ Rose Garden

results.description:
Join members and guests of Social Fun (SF) and South Shore Hike Bike & Social Club (SSHBSC) for a Saturday evening of socializing while playing billiards/pool as we start the new year!  We already bowl here so let's play pool!  O'Lindy's is fun yet laidback and is a great place to bowl, play pool, and socialize with friends.  Join us for a couple of hours on Saturday night as we socialize and play pool.  We did this on Friday, November 13th and had such a fun time we're doing it again as requested!

O'Lindy's sells snacks and beverages, including alcohol.   We are requesting $6pp for tonight's event to cover the cost of the pool table rentals and snacks.  While the event begins @ 7:30pm you can join us anytime, however, we highly recommend arriving by 8:30pm.  There are no discounts for late arrivals.   Any leftover money will be reimbursed to members for a dollar apiece and/or sent to Biagio to help cover the cost of the group.  (Please see "Cost/Fees" section below for more info.)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 


Saturday Night South Shore Billiards/Pool Social!!

Saturday, January 16th @ 7:30-9:30pm

O'Lindy's

170 Quincy Avenue (Route 53 SB)

Quincy, MA 02169

Phone #[masked]

Website: http://olindysbowling.com/

Meeting Location:  Please meet near the front desk.  If you arrive after we head to our pool tables look for a meetup sign.  The reservation is under "Angela" and "Meetup."

Host/Organizer: Chris Dindy & Angela (Reservation is under Meetup and Chris.)

Min/Max: Minimum of 10 people 48 hours prior to the event.  Maximum of 30 total attendees.

Guests: 2 Adults (21+) per Member
Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for our meals in cash allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone.
Cost/Fees: Each pool table is $12/hr w/ a $10 deposit.  We will be collecting $6pp to cover the cost of pool and appetizers/snacks that we will order and/or bring.  (Please note, we rarely collect event fees but we do need to pay for pool and some snacks may add to the fun of the evening.)  If you want to make your annual $10 voluntary contribution to Social Fun I will be happy to collect and mail it to Biagio and it will cover your cost for tonight's event.  Biagio requests a $10 donation after attending your 3rd event.  (If half the people who attended 3+ events actually made the donation it would be a one-time request.  Alas, not so.)

RSVP Deadline: Saturday, January 16th @ 3pm ~ Any changes made after this time will be considered a No-Show so please finalize your RSVP by this time.

Inclement Weather Reschedule Date: TBD

No-Show Policy:  People who RSVP "Yes" to events are expected to exercise common sense and common courtesy. That means making your best effort to keep any commitments that you make, but if necessary doing your best to notify the Event Organizer or (preferably, if it's the day of the event) the venue if something comes up after the RSVP deadline. If you find yourself unable to attend an event that you've RSVPed "Yes" to and you cannot either change your RSVP or let the venue know, please do contact the Event Organizer when you're able to, just to let us know that you're okay and that you're still interested in attending events.  Please be advised that any Assistant Organizer (AO) or the Group Organizer (GO) can remove a member from Social Fun who has 3 No-Shows in the past 3 months.  Additionally, Organizers may disallow members with 2 or more "No Show" marks from attending their events.  *Please keep in mind that we are reserving pool tables based on the number of people who RSVP Yes to attend and if we show-up missing more than 10% of the people it has an adverse affect on everyone else attending as well as the venue as we are planning based on RSVPs and if there's a Waitlist (WL) then you are taking away a spot for someone else if you do not change your RSVP when you are no longer able to attend.*

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Parking: Free parking on-site and in their extended lot across the street.  If lots are full drive north on Route 53 to the next set of lights where you will take a right (onto Scammell Street) and then you can take a left into the big free parking lot where Quincy Credit Union and a gym are located.  (Please do not park in the strip mall or Citizens Bank parking lots.)

Directions/Location Overview:  This is located on Route 53 NB in Quincy about 2 miles from the Braintree line and less than 1/2 mile from Kam Man Plaza (where Bradlees used to be over 2 decades ago).  This is also on the bus line which you can catch from the Quincy Center T station.  For exact directions, please go to their website or google map it.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Front Desk and then at our Pool tables thereafter.  Reservation is under "Angela" and "Meetup."
results.name: Saturday Night South Shore Billiards/Pool Social!!

results.description:
CSC is beyond excited for one of our dreams come true. Are you ready for the one and only Carl Craig?

Carl Craig is described as a creative visionary, an electronic music icon, an esteemed Grammy-nominated composer, a world-class DJ and an ambassador for
his native Detroit. Yet the common thread that runs through Craig’s broad musical
canon and creative projects is a resounding fascination with futurism. The prolific
producer has cultivated a unique path as an artist, entrepreneur and civic leader,
guided by his tendency toward forward thinking.

“My livelihood is making music that I can perform, whether I’m doing orchestral
production or modular strangeness or generating club music. I don’t restrict
myself,” said Craig. “I defined myself by being who I am. The ultimate self respect
is when you say you’re going to do something and you go and do it to the best of
your ability.”

Craig released his first track in 1989 on a Virgin UK compilation album, with two
singles following on labels run by his first collaborator Derrick May. After a series
of ambitious releases for his co-owned Retroactive imprint, in 1991 Craig launched
his second record label Planet E with the groundbreaking EP “4 Jazz Funk Classics”,
under his alias 69. Planet-E turned 20 in 2011 and Craig celebrated the label’s
history by taking Planet-E and its artists and collaborators on a world tour for the
first time ever. He also previewed the 69 Live show for the first time, at select
festivals around the world, fusing masks, darkness and the music of 69, Craig
created 69’s own entity. As well as this, Planet-E invited friends of the label – like
Luciano, Kirk Del Giorgio, Loco Dice and more - to pick their favourite Planet-E
track to remix and re-release. Reflecting a year that was packed with events and
releases, Craig readily admits that when he started the label he was hoping “it
would last forever.” He cites artistic freedom as the highlight of running the label
and adds, “It was never a struggle for the label to be an outlet for my or other
people's music. It was always a struggle to stay in business, actually a war to stay
in business.”

:: DOWNSTAIRS ::

CARL CRAIG

CHAD SPIGNER

MATT MCNEILL

21+
Party by CSC
Visuals by Jon Von Bonk

https://www.facebook.com/events/1593897024269328/
results.name: CSC presents SWEET SHOP w/ CARL CRAIG

results.description:
NOTE: Season 6 will be led by veteran Senior Percolator, Mike Murphy.  We are honored to be mentored by an industry professional who brings enthusiasm and wit to this challenging journey ahead of us.  Expect an e-mail from Mike on launch day.  Let's start jAMmin'!

jQuery jAM, our virtual self-study group focused on JavaScript, jQuery and related technologies, is returning for Season 6.  This season will provide intermediate training in the fundamentals of programming using JavaScript.  Prior experience with HTML and CSS is a plus. While no prior JavaScript knowledge is required, the text we will be using is likely to challenge us.  (See comments below by Mike Murphy, Senior Percolator.)

The book we will be using for this journey is Eloquent JavaScript: A Modern Introduction to Programming (second edition).


The format of a virtual self-study group is as follows:

• Each participant obtains a copy of the same textbook: Eloquent JavaScript: A Modern Introduction to Programming (second edition).

• Each participant commits to read one chapter per week, complete the exercises and post links to your completed work.

• Each participant obtains assistance by posting questions to a discussion area set up on the Boston PHP Message Board for each chapter.  Each participant will receive personal feedback, as well as, a weekly group e-mail update.

• Each participant who completes the book is recognized on the Self-Study Group | Wall of Accomplishment.

Note: There is no classroom instruction. There are no webcasts. There are no scheduled appointments of any kind.

Once you have access to the book, you simply proceed at a pace that best fits into your current work/life schedule.  You DO NOT need to live in the Boston area to participate.  Invite your friends, family members and co-workers to join in the fun!

How do I get started?

• Become a member of Boston PHP if you are not already a member. Simply click: Join us!

• Register for jQuery jAM, Season 6.  Simply RSVP: Yes

• Obtain a copy of the book; you can read it online for FREE.  If you chose to purchase the book (the only program cost), simply visit Amazon.com and order Eloquent JavaScript: A Modern Introduction to Programming (second edition) in one of two formats -- paperback or Kindle.

When your book arrives, start your virtual learning by reading one chapter at a time, completing the exercises and posting a link to your completed work.

FAQs:

Q: How long will the course last?

A: We will cover 21 chapters in the book starting Sunday, January 17 and ending Saturday, June 11.  Refer to the jQuery jAM, Season 6 -- Master Discussion List (coming soon) for specific dates.

Q: Do I have to wait until Sunday, January 17 to begin?

A: No need to wait! Feel free to begin as soon as you obtain a copy of your book.  Simply post a message on the Introduce Yourself: jQuery jAM, Season 6 message board once you receive your book so that we can gauge participation. Then, proceed at a pace that best fits your current work/life schedule.

Q: Do I have to live in Boston to participate?

A: Not at all. This program is virtual. We have successful graduates from many states and even have graduates from countries in Europe and Africa.

Q: What if I have additional questions?

A: Simply post a reply below and you will receive a response.

Let's start jAMmin'!!

Mike Murphy
Senior Percolator

Gene Babon
Chief Percolator
results.name: jQuery jAM, Season 6

Make your reservations early. This will sell out. Right now this is tour is open to the public so unless you <a>book</a> and pay for your spot early, you might miss out. If we can get 40 or more we'll get our own bus. So tell your friends. I will be posting this in my other group so maybe we can get to 40 or more. Help me !

You have to make your reservations online. 


MAKE SURE YOU PUT "(MEETUP)" after your name so they know to put you on our bus. Example - Roger Leary (MEETUP)

Reserve Online to guarantee your seat <a>www.newenglandsnowbus.com</a>  or call[masked]

PICKUP <a>Locations</a> & times ........................................................


Andover, MA Park n Ride 6:45 am (I-93 Exit 42 at Dascomb Road)

Boston, MA 808 Commonwealth Ave 6:00 am


Rockland, MA Park n Ride (Rte 3 Exit 14) 5:30 am

<a>schedule</a> subject to change (see website)


http://newenglandsnowbus.com/


FAQs ...............................................................................................


Can minors go alone? - NO, they need an adult present. 

Can we bring food on the bus? - Yes. 

Can we bring alcohol on the bus? - No.

Can we go and not ski? - Yes. Bus ride only $45

Can we go XC Skiing? - Maybe - I'm/they're working on that for us. 

Can we have a rocking good time? - HELL YES !!!!

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]


=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to three of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - Eisenhower, Pierce, and Jackson. We will use Crawford Path, Webster Cliff Trail, and Webster Jackson Trail. The AMC's Mizpah Hut is closed for the season.

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.

RSVPs close 24 hours before the event.

The maximum group size for this trip will be 10 people. 

Guests aren't permitted.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 11.5 miles and climb about 4,400 feet. It should take an average hiker about 8 hours to complete. This event is considered ADVANCED because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/11-Mt-Eisenhower-4780--27-Mt-Pierce-4310

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/38-Mt-Jackson-4052


Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants.


Use this link for the current weather forecast:

• http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lon=-71.30365675019486&lat=44.27038780496076#.VjjteITO5_Y 


=== What to Bring ===


Don't wear ANY cotton - this includes your socks and underwear. You will need winter hiking boots - if you wear them in the summer they aren't designed for winter use (e.g. insulation). You will need mountaineering snow shoes. Not all snowshoes are the same - some are designed for steep terrain with potentially deep snow while others aren't. These are the acceptable brands and models:

• Tubbs Flex ALP, Flex VRT, Flex TRK, or Mountaineers.

• MSR Lightening, Revo, or Evo. 

• TSL Symbioz Elite or Expert. 

• Atlas Aspect, Endeavor, or Series 10/11/12.

You will also need traction - while you can bring mountaineering crampons if you want I think all you will need is either Kahtoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike:


• </a><a href="http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf">http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet at the Webster Jackson Trailhead which is located on the south side of Route 302 about 1/2 mile south of the AMC's Highland Center. Since this is where we will end the day we will leave a few cars there and drive to the starting spot.

Use this link to customize the driving directions:

• https://goo.gl/maps/Y2my6Tc2VDM2

</a>

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

results.description:
We'll hike 9 mi. starting at Rte. 114 thru Boxford State Forest, JC Phillips Wildlife Sanctuary, and Lockwood Forest before ending in Boxford Center!

This Hike Will require a car spot! We will meet at the end of hike and carpool to the beginning!

Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. I am committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up. 

Please note this is not a beginners’ hike. It is for intermediate level hikers and beginning hikers who keep in fit condition doing other things. You should be in good enough physical condition to keep up and stay with the group going at a moderate pace. Please do not show up for an event unexpected or unprepared.Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy rain or extreme temperature cancels.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event. 

Please remember that I am a volunteer, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

 By signing up and/or attending this hike you agree to the Liability Waiver Below:
Remember: I am a volunteer. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason

results.description:
Integrated Energy Therapy Class

With Master-Instructor Lisa Mastrocola Basic IET Class

9:30-4:00 + (depending on group size) $195 Integrated Energy Therapy®

(IET) is a safe, gentle, nurturing way to empower and balance your life by helping you release patterns of the past for good.

Feelings and sensations are stored in the cells of the body much like facts are stored in the cells of the brain. Negative or traumatic experiences, stress, unexpressed emotion, fear, anger, resentment or self-limiting beliefs can become “stuck” (or suppressed) in the body and inhibit or disrupt the flow of vital life force at a cellular level. These energy blockages limit our experience of life and can result in a lack of spontaneity, energy depletion, a feeling of unrest, agitation or dis-ease. 

IET uses a unique Cellular Memory Map® to target specific areas in the body where these “cellular memories” are stored, helping to release them on all levels – physical, emotional, mental, and spiritual. As these blocks are cleared, your energy field is re-balanced. The more your energy body opens and vital life force can flow freely through it, the closer you move to a natural state of being: pure joy.

Our IET training classes are each powerful days of self-healing and energy therapy certification training. In each class, you will be attuned to a powerful angelic energy ray that activates your 12-strand Spiritual DNA. You will then learn how to heartlink to the energy of your angels and use their energy for healing. You will learn how each primary human emotion is correlated to a specific physical region of the body, as well as how to use the IET integration power points to clear them. Fully illustrated training guide and certificate provided with each class.
No prior energy therapy experience needed. You can be an energy intuitive, and through these IET classes, you will be taught how to feel and interpret energy flow, clear energy patterns in yourself and others, and unlock your soul’s purpose.

Our basic training class provides you with an:

· Attunement to the Basic IET energy ray that will activate the 1st and 2nd DNA pairs and will empower you to energize and integrate cellular memory blocks

· Location and use of the IET energy integration power points

· Introduction to Energy Anatomy and the Cellular Memory Map

· Increase in your ability to be an energy intuitive and “read” energy.

results.description:
Doors for the event open at 10:00 AM for coffee and conversation, with the program starting at 10:30. We hope to see you there!


Featured Speaker: Arianna Smith, Vice President of Boston Oasis - "The Neuroscience of the Senses"

     Ari will explore the neural architecture that allows us to sense the world around us, as well as recent technological advances that look to repair or even augment the ways that we experience and interact with our surroundings.

Community Moment: Jim Hollomon - "Nothing"


=========================================

Oasis meets in the Teen Center at the YMCA. To find the room, enter through the lower entrance (on Dartmouth Street, by the swimming pool), and follow Oasis signs from the front lobby to the Teen Center on the second floor. (Note: the stairwell to the Teen Center is NOT the stairwell in the front lobby. That is Stairwell A. The Teen Center is located at Stairwell B, next to the Yoga Studio. Oasis volunteers will be available to help provide assistance, and signage will be posted.

=========================================

Greater Boston Oasis is a secular community dedicated to providing for the human need for social and intellectual community, for those people who may not want or be able to have those needs met in a church or other faith-based community. 

Our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs

Reality is known through reason

Meaning comes from making a difference

Human hands solve human problems

Be accepting, and be accepted


Atheist or agnostic, freethinker or skeptic, deist or theist, all those with whom those values resonate are welcome to celebrate the human experience.
results.how_to_find_us: Follow signs from the entrance to the Teen Center room. Use the Dartmouth Street entrance, and head to Stairwell B. Teen Center is on the 2nd floor.
results.name: Weekly Sunday Gathering - Ari Smith: The Neuroscience of the Senses

results.description:
Prepare for another day of hacking! Dario from HTC will join us, bringing a shiny new Vive Pre! We'll experience and experiment with the Pre (and the two Vive DK1's), and do our usual hack-day, but focused on experimenting with the Vive, by adding SteamVR support to our existing VR projects, or jamming on new room-and-hand ideas.  Anybody ready to write code, craft environments, explore VR art, hack on hardware, or otherwise build VR, is invited to come! 

The RSVP cost of the event covers a big pizza order for lunch.

Mike Festa and Wayfair have, once again and on short notice, agreed to host us -- many thanks to Mike and Wayfair!

DIRECTIONS:
By T: Back Bay station (Orange Line) is across the street, and Copley station (Green Line) is a 5 minute walk away.
By car: You can park at 131 Dartmouth Street, across the street from Copley Place / Wayfair -- unfortunately the garage is nearly $40 for the day, so consider the T!
Once you're there: Go into the Copley Place mall and find the elevators behind the central fountain. Head up to the "Sky Lobby", and check in with security, who'll give you a visitor badge and direct you to another set of elevators up to Wayfair. 

PLEASE NOTE: We won't be doing general demos of the Vives at this hackathon, since we need to keep the kits available for developers to work with. If you want to see the Vive, but aren't working on a VR app, come to the Boston VR meetup on 1/27 instead!
results.name: Boston VR Vive Hackathon

Sometimes participants bring print-outs of articles, research, or books to share on the topic, and sometimes people just come with a story or opinion to share.

We loosely moderate the topical discussion to give everyone a chance to participate. Then the conversation often flows onto other related subjects, sometimes in smaller conversation groups around the table.

results.description: Join our experts for an exciting hike in the wilderness of Estabrook Woods, the largest contiguous and undeveloped woodland within 30 miles of Boston. Located just two miles north of Concord, this wild tract of land has more than 1,200 acres of woods, hills, ledges and wetlands and offers an extensive network of trails to explore. We'll take you on some of our favorite trails where you'll have a chance to see the abundant wildlife that inhabits this area. Please make sure you wear appropriate hiking clothing; waterproof footwear (if possible) and dress for the weather (layers; no cotton). Please bring a small day pack with extra clothes, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need.  Ages 8 and up are welcome.  Hope to see you on the trail!

results.description:
Our Speaker this month is Rick Heller, rejoining us after the release of his new book at the end of 2015. We'll be getting together to learn about Secular Meditation and relax - so wear your jammies and slippers, if you're inclined (just remember, we're a family friendly event!)

__


Rick Heller is the author of Secular Meditation: 32 Practices for Cultivating Inner Peace, Compassion, and Joy — A Guide from the Humanist Community at Harvard. He leads meditations on Tuesday nights at the Humanist Hub.

He received a master's degree in journalism from Boston University and also holds degrees in public policy and engineering from Harvard and MIT. His writing has appeared in the Humanist, Free Inquiry, UUWorld, Tikkun, Buddhadharma, the Boston Globe, and Lowell Sun. His website, rickheller.com, presents free meditation videos in English and Spanish. He can be found on Twitter @SecularMeditate.

results.description:
Our services have three parts: Healing Service, a Lecture on a spiritual topic, and Mediumship Spirit Communication. Each part lasts approximately 30 minutes.

The Healing Service gives you the opportunity to receive healing energy that is channeled through one of our Healers. We believe that healing can be channeled through thought to those who need it. This is a very calming experience, whether or not you choose to sit in a healing chair.  We encourage you to send healing to your loved ones, our communities, and Mother Earth.

The Lecture covers a variety of topics ranging from the History of Spiritualism to Inspired Insights. It also includes examples of how Spiritualism is a part of our lives on a daily basis.

Mediumship, or Spirit Communication, is the part of the service where a medium proves that "...the existence and personal identity of the individual continue after the change called death." The medium might be a member of our church or visiting from another the Spiritualist church in the community. We also have mediums from abroad stop in often. While there is only enough time during a service for a few people to receive messages from their deceased loved ones on the Higher side Side of Life, everyone present benefits by witnessing proof of the continuation of life.

At the conclusion of the service everyone is invited to our social hour downstairs for coffee and conversation.﻿
results.name: Sunday Service

venue.name: Ryles Jazz Club

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,


Let's do brunch at the Ryles Jazz Club!  

Ryles is a wonderful venue with lots of character, great music and food. 

This event will feature three Berklee College of Music faculty, Diane Wernick (saxophones), Carolyn Wilkins (piano and vocals) and Skip Smith (bass), and also Phil Neighbors of the Harvey Finstein School of Music at Lasell College. So sit back, relax and enjoy a delicious brunch to the sounds of Bon Voyage. 

http://www.rylesjazz.com/month.cfm?month=01/2016

In order for this event to be successful, we will need to be organized and follow some rules.


• Rule number 1 - Please show-up if you reserved "yes"

• Rule Number 2 - Be on time!

• Rule Number 3 - Please be financially prepared to pay for your meal including taxes and tip. 

(Meal sales tax is 6.25% and group tip is at least 18%.  Total your portion of the bill and add 24.25%, round it up to 25%.)

The restaurant policy is to only seat the group when all members have arrived.  If you are late, please understand that we cannot wait for you or guarantee that you will be able to join the group.  It is not fair to ask fellow members who arrived early to wait any longer for latecomers.  Most importantly, it is not fair for the restaurant to hold empty seats and lose business for latecomers or for people who fail to show-up.  

If you reserve "yes" and are no longer able to attend, please adjust your reservation as soon as possible. There will most likely be a waiting list and a false reservation will take away another person's chance to enjoy this event.  


I will be sending reminder emails asking you to reconfirm your attendance the day before the event. If you do not reconfirm your attendance, I will assume that you are no longer coming and therefore remove you from the attendance roster and give your space to the next person on the waiting list. 

 I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.  


Joana

****Ryles Jazz Club Details***

http://www.ryles.com/


http://www.ryles.com/directions.cfm (Directions)


Ryles is located in the heart of Inman Square with lots of access to public transportation.  To plan your travel via public transportation, visit the MBTA web site's Rider Tools, http://www.mbta.com/rider_tools/. 

http://www.ryles.com/brunch.cfm (brunch menu)


***Parking***

On Sunday, parking meters are free.  If you can not find a meter, Ryles has a tiny parking lot on Hampshire Street between Armory and Prospect Streets, across from the Hess Express gas station/adjacent to the 7-Eleven.  In addition, you may also park across the street at S&S Restaurant, their sister restaurant.
results.how_to_find_us: at the entrance, at the host station
results.name: Jazz Brunch at Ryles!

results.description:
Hi Urban Sketchers!

Let's head to the Waterworks Museum to sketch.  The plan is to meet in the lobby of the museum between 11:15 - 11:30am.  We will then disperse to sketch and then meet back in the lobby at 1:30pm to share our work.

Here's a link to the museum's website:  http://waterworksmuseum.org/

_______________________________________________________________

From the museum's website:

Ever wonder where your water comes from? Before you say “from the tap,” think again. It had to get to the tap from somewhere. But where? And how?

That’s where we come in.

The Waterworks Museum is located on the site of the original Chestnut Hill Reservoir and pumping station. By the 1880’s, Boston’s water system couldn’t keep up with the rapid growth of the city and its water needs. Chestnut Hill was identified as the location for a new reservoir and main pumping station. The original station was built in 1887, but by the 1890’s, it was clear that demand had quickly outstripped the ability to transport sufficient water. The need for more water resulted in the installation of increasingly powerful (and enormous!) pumping engines, which operated every day until the 1970’s, when the site was taken offline, and Boston’s water supply shifted to the Quabbin Reservoir. The Chestnut Hill Reservoir, however, is still used as a back-up source of water in case of emergencies.

So why visit us?

We tell some important regional stories about clean water, health, people, brilliant engineers, and magnificent architecture. Our stories tell how Boston grew to be the city it is today.

You can explore the remarkable machinery, wonder at the massive wrenches that kept the pumps running, and marvel at the beautiful architecture. You can take a walking tour of the Chestnut Hill Reservoir, the centerpiece of an extraordinary landscaping project, or venture out on an all-day bus excursion, led by experts on all things water-related. You can attend special events, talks, or if you are a teacher, visit with a school group. In the future, you will be able to hear podcasts of some of our events!

If that’s not enough, come because it’s a fun way to learn about your city’s history!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the lobby of the museum
results.name: Let's Sketch the Waterworks Museum!

results.description:
GET TOGETHER ONLY FOR GREEK ISLAND CRUISER'S 

GREEK LANGUAGE/CULTURE LESSON AND BRUNCH!!!

Just as promised by NSS for those that have booked for the cruise: JOIN NORTH SHORE SOCIAL AND EIRINI KAY ON A DREAM CRUISE TO THE GREEK ISLANDS!!!

MORE INFO ON CRUISE CALL CARLA AT: [masked] 


We will be meeting at Family Fare (Peabody) for brunch in their private family room.

 Eirini Kay will be giving a little back round of Greek culture and some basic Greek phrases that will make our cruise even more memorable.

Please bring: Note book, pen or pencil, a good appetite and lots of humor. Be prepared to laugh your pants off, trying to pronounce many of the Greek words!

 This get together will also give you the  chance to meet your fellow travelers and find room mates if you need too!

Family Fare will allow us to use their family room free of charge as long as all attending, eat well we are there. Please make sure to tip our servers well!

FAMILY FARE MENU OPTIONS: BREAKFAST AND LUNCH

Please note we have about 50 people signed up to travel with us on the Greek Island Cruise and this event will only have a limit of 10 spaces. I will try to have one a month till May when we leave.

SO PLEASE do not RSVP yes, in less you are quite sure you can attend. We understand things happen so please have an updated RSVP the latest the day before, so I can have an accurate head count.

 MULTIPLE MEETUP EVENT SPONSORED BY:

 NORTH SHORE SOCIAL

 PLEASE RSVP FOR THIS EVENT IN ONLY ONE GROUP

 AND KEEP YOUR RSVP UP TO DATE!

 Be safe, Yours truly Eirini Kay

  SEE YOU THERE!!!

What our members are saying about North Shore Social:

“Great time. Can't wait until the next adventure”

“Wonderful people having lots of fun. Thank you Eirini for all you do for NSS. You do a fantastic job at organizing the group and your events.”

“The Greek Night Party was so much fun. Thank you so much. The food Eirini cooked was out of this world. Eirini did such a good job organizing the event and making sure everyone had a blast. I would recommend North Shore Social to everyone.”

Need a little more convincing?

Click here to see the rest of our 90+ testimonials!

Calling all January Birthday Celebrators to come out and enjoy a birthday brunch at Tremont 647. I checked out this restaurant and so far, it's been nothing but positive reviews. Not only is the food great, but on Sundays they host a Pajama brunch, with waiters in PJs. Customers in PJs receive recognition from staff. I say we give this fun place a try!

*Brunch includes a free birthday cake and songs! For those of you who will be attending, if your birthday is in January, please send birthday info to me so that I may share with the group. For all others, please come out and wish our friends a happy birthday. thanks!
results.name: January Birthday Brunch and cake@Tremont 647

results.description:
Come join us at our regular Scrabble Meetup, and play over lunch or a pastry and some coffee!

We meet twice a month, every month, on the first and third Sunday. Please bring a board if you have one. We have a few spares, so you are welcome to come even if you forget your board.

Newcomers are always welcome. We keep 2 and 3 letter "cheat sheets" for new folks to keep the playing field more even.

We mostly play Scrabble one-on-one, and pairing is random. If you would like to be matched up to someone of a similar skill, just let the organizer know.

Au Bon Pain is right next to the Davis Square T stop, and there is typically ample free street parking on Sundays.  A few times a year, there is a race in Davis Square that shuts down some streets, so keep an eye out for that. If possible I will send out a message to the group the day before.

$2/Meetup goes to help pay for the annual Meetup.com dues and miscellaneous photocopying, but if you are a regular $15/year will be easier for you and me to keep track of!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the people with Scrabble boards out--the cafe is usually empty on Sundays.
results.name: Twice-Monthly Scrabble Meetup (Third Sunday of the Month)

results.description:
Greetings Scrabble Fans!
Let's take another great opportunity to get together and play Scrabble!

Please don't forget to RSVP. $1.00 registration fee is due at the start of the meetup. While not required, if you have a Scrabble set, please feel free to bring it with you. All skill levels and abilities welcome!

Looking forward to seeing MORE of you in 2016,
Lisa

The purpose of this group is to share our spirituality and spiritual experience(s), discuss our paths and investigate the ideas and techniques of all spiritualities and traditions, particularly the Mystical Dimension.  We meet downstairs at Panera, unless or some reason we have to go upstairs.

Agenda:

We go around the circle and discuss our paths and evolution.

We also ask for suggested topics to discuss.

There will usually be a short talk on some spiritual subject

Occasionally we have other experts visit and give a talk.

If someone in the group would like to give a talk or seminar, let me know.
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of Walden St and Mass Ave.
results.name: Intros, Discussion of our Paths & Spiritual Topics. Talk on subjects of interest

results.description:
Note: this event will be on court 3 rather than the usual court 1.

We have rented 3 badminton courts at the BU Fitness & Recreation Center (regulation full sized courts).  The BU facility is immaculate and a fantastic place to play.


The fee (payable online when you RSVP) gets you into the BU Fitness & Recreation Center to play badminton for an hour and a half.  Part of the fee is for the court time and the rest is for your meetup group to cover other expenses, i.e. rackets, shuttlecocks/birdies, meetup.com fees. All fees collected go to pay the Group's expenses.

We have rackets and shuttles for everyone!

Expect to play doubles. The host can help to match up pairs but members are free to join in any game they want.  The courts are reserved only for Boston Badminton members.

Before asking a question, please read through the following FAQs:

Q: The meetup is full, can I come regardless and pay at the event?
A: No, there is limited space to make sure everyone gets to play. A few spots typically open up before the event.

Q: It's my first time, how do I find you?
A: Go to the BU Fitness & Recreation Center reception (see directions below), and tell them you're here with Boston Badminton. They'll tell you where the courts are, check you're on the list, and make you sign a waiver. The meeting point is on the courts.

Q: I am a BU student, do I get a discount?
A: No, BU charges us the same regardless of whether participants are at BU or not.


Directions:
Please click here for a google map to The BU Fitness & Recreation Center.  The easiest way to get to the FitRec center from within Boston is to take the Green Line (B)-Boston College to Saint Paul St.  Parking is limited but available.  Please click here for parking information.

Plan to grab a drink locally after if we have interest.

The club has full locker room and shower facilities.

Note: In addition to agreeing to the Meetup's Liability Waiver, all members must sign a Waiver of Liability Form in order to use BU's courts. This form is available at the front desk at the FitRec center.  We may ask you for your full name in order to help BU and the meetup comply with the liability procedures.

Let me know if you have any questions and I hope to see you there!

Liability Waiver

By attending a Boston Badminton meetup, you hereby agree to the terms of the following Liability Waiver:

The purpose of the following Liability Waiver is to protect Boston Badminton meetup members and group leaders from liability in case of accident or injury. All members must agree to the Liability Waiver in order to participate in the group and its activities.

As part of my membership to Boston Badminton on Meetup.com (hereinafter “Boston Badminton”), I hereby freely and voluntarily agree to the following Release, Acknowledgment of Risk, and Waiver of Liability:

In consideration of the opportunity to participate in events, activities, classes, and programs conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates in any venue, and to use equipment located therein, I, on behalf of myself and my minor children, do hereby release, hold harmless and forever discharge and agree not to sue Boston Badminton and its trustees, officers, agents, founders, members, volunteers and employees (together, "Meetup.com Group") from any and all claims, responsibilities or liabilities for injury or damages resulting from or arising out of my or my family’s use of, presence in, or participation in activities conducted at any venue rented or owned by Boston Badminton, whether or not caused by the ordinary negligence of Boston Badminton. I understand, recognize and acknowledge that certain activities conducted by Boston Badminton or taking place in venues rented or owned by Boston Badminton are potentially hazardous. I also acknowledge that it is my responsibility to follow instructions for any activity or use of equipment, and to seek help from the volunteers if I have any questions. I further understand that, notwithstanding precautions taken by Boston Badminton, sports and fitness activities involve a risk of injury and/or death. I/we are voluntarily participating in these activities and using equipment and machinery with knowledge of the dangers involved. I hereby agree to expressly assume and accept any and all risks associated with my participation in activities conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates. I have read the foregoing and hereby agree to be bound by same.
results.name: Badminton @ BU, SUN 12:30-2 pm (1/17/2015)

results.description:
Small Doggy Playdates is conveniently held at The Meadows Pet Resort and Spa in Holliston, 140 Summer Street. We meet mostly every 3rd Sunday of the month, 1:00 pm - 2:30 pm.


The Meadows is a multi-million dollar pet resort. The resort provides us with a large, clean indoor room with windows, chairs, water bowls, and plenty of room for our small dogs to play and socialize. Your dog can run around and play with others, off leash, in a safe environment.  

• All small and toy breeds are welcome. We look forward to having owners of FRIENDLY, EASY-GOING dogs (UNDER 18 lbs), with GOOD DOGGY MANNERS come play and make new friends. Please be sure your small dog(s) is healthy, clean, spayed or neutered, flea-free, and up-to-date with shots. If your pup(s) shows aggression or excessively barks towards others, you may be asked to leave.

• Due to the increase in participation at our PlayDates in Holliston, parking has become limited. The Holliston Meadows staff has asked us to please park directly across the street at Fatima Shrine where there is ample FREE parking for all. 

• To be sure there is enough seating, feel free to bring your own folding chair. 

• Due to some food allergy-prone dogs, please refrain from feeding your dog treats or snacks during the PlayDate. Their Moms and Dads will greatly appreciate this.
results.name: Small Doggy PlayDates - RSVP Now for Sunday, Jan 17

The Group uses the "Beatles Complete Chord Book" as its bible for instrumental keys, however there are many resources to find lyrics (if you even need them).

Join us for this timeless tale of love, evil, betrayal and redemption in a tightly-woven 90-minute production.

Sunday brunch before the show at Barcelona Wine Bar & Restaurant @ 525 Tremont St at 1pm. Bring cash.
Thank you, everyone, who confirmed brunch attendance. All reserved spots have been claimed. Check your Meetup messages and/or emails. Remember: bring cash!!!

Performance begins at 3pm. Duration: 1h 40 min including one intermission. 


Nicholas Place, Music Director

Patricia-Maria Weinmann, Stage Director


Cast for Jan 17, accompanied by piano and string quartet:

Faust: Salvatore Atti
Marguerite: Emily Jensen
Mephistopheles: Brian Church
Siebel: Krista Marie Laskowski

If you have not RSVP'd before 1/8 and need the discount code, send me a message via Meetup.
